Posts.Content: You've got my prayers for you!
Posts.Title: Burning sensation and pain in left breast

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply. My skin does have that tender/burning feeling when lightly touching it. That happened before icing it. I'm told that there are a ton of nerves in the breast and with a stereotactic, it can definitely effect the nerves. Now, whether that is true or not, I'm not sure. I'm wondering if one would have the nerve pain from the sterotactic if they didn't have a hematoma?
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Yes, I had a titanium mark put in. So, the Dr's are saying that your pain is unusual? What did they say to do? At what point do we start to think that the pain is abnormal? I just don't want to keep "running in circles" as I stated before with this but on the other hand feel like no one really knows what to do about
 pain from the biopsy after a certain amount of time except give you another mammogram and I don't want all that radiation.when I had my first biopsy which was totally messed up, they took pictures before and after the procedure and they took about
 14 pictures. Ummm...I'm no expert but to me, that seems like a lot of radiation and when I got my second biopsy (which they knew what they were doing) they were able to do the biopsy off of my pictures that I got the first time and didn't do any more mammograms afterwards and sent in the sample. He said that he took more than normal just to cover the area and I agreed to that. So, now we are trying to establish back a normal baseline and they want to do an ultrasound and mammogram 6 mo from the date of the procedure. Still nervous about
 getting a mammogram regarding the radiation exposure.
Do you have a lot of pain or just when you do certain things? Can you sleep on that side? I wore a tank top instead of a "bra" for the first few weeks after the biopsy. I'm thinking that was not a good idea because I think the gravity pulled on the hematoma which I think slows the healing process.
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: Okay, so here's an update....so now it's been 3 1/2 months since biopsy. I am still getting twinges of pain on that side. I still feel a little bump from one of the hematomas and if pressure is applied, it is sore. Not too bad but enough to know the soreness is there. Now with that being said, I'm not sure if this has anything to do with it, but I did start my period 8 days early and it was lighter than usual and only lasted 4 1/2 days which normally mine go 6 days. Anyway, the discomfort on the side where my biposy was can be any where on that side nit just at the biopsy site. Really? This long afterwards? Will it ever get better?
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: I just got this "burning" sensation today and my question is, could it be a referred burning type sensation from a sterotactic biopsy from the other breast? Could it be PMS related? The Dr told me since I have a hemotoma from the biopsy that it could take 3 months or more to heal. I have nerve type pain on the breast that had the biposy. How long can nerve pain last?
Posts.Title: Burning sensation and pain in left breast

Posts.Content: I have fibrocystic breasts as well as dense breasts. I've had a sterotactic biposy in my right breast (which came out fibrocystic/benign), an MRI on both breasts and now I have off and on discomfort in my right breast and a pulled muscle/spasm feeling from time to time in my left breast. I am told that pain or discomfort can linger for many months after a biopsy. I am now on week 11. But I'm wondering if the left breast issue is referred pain from chronic neck and back pain? Although I have had the chronic neck and back pain for a long time, the breast thing on that side just started. Sometimes I will wear a tank top under my clothes instead of a vra and wonder if the gravity of not wearing a bra has anything to do with it. Anyone have any ideas?
Posts.Title: Burning sensation and pain in left breast

Posts.Content: How long is ages?
Posts.Title: Burning sensation and pain in left breast

Posts.Content:
Okay, it's now almost 2 months since I have had my biopsy and although my hematoma bump has gone down quite a bit, sometimes it can really hurt. Yesterday I put on a tube top bra and it seemed like the pressure of the bra made the area of the hematoma hurt. Really? Two months later? Is that even normal that the pressure of a bra can irritate that tiny little gematoma now? Well, it sure kept me from sleeping on that side too. Does all this sound normal? I'm 3 days off of my monthly cycle now and wondered if ovulation could cause breast pain, but then I thought...same area as the hematoma so I ruled the ovulation thing out.
I'm so tired of hurting off and on with this. I feel like my breast will never get back to normal. Will it ever?
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Hi, well it's almost been 9 mo now since my biopsy and here's where I am at...
The pain has mostly gone but not always. I woke up last night because of the pain from laying on that side. I am premenopausal and wonder if hormone fluctuation can cause pain in the scar tissue that I was told that I had? Remember, I had two biopsies a week a part because they didn't get in the right area they needed to the first time. Does anyone feel that after getting this biopsy that one breast now feels lumpier than the other one? I did have my 6 month follow up. I now believe that the reason for the fibrocystic change was because of now being in premenopause which back then, I thought it was because of too much caffeine. Any thought? I just didn't think the tenderness/off and on pain would have been gone by now but then again, the fluctuating hormones may magnify pain.
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: So almost 3 weeks now and what dr's are calling a hematoma is still there and I have pain off and on. The skin feels very tender to the touch where the hematoma is. Is this normal? I fell asleep last night with an ice pack of solid frozen water in it and the ice pack was on through the night. Will that cause damage? The reason I ask is because they say to ice the area for 10 min or so at a time and I fell asleep with it on me for hours. Do you suppose the skin around the area that is tender to the touch a nerve thing or is it tender due to the hematoma itself? I can't seem to get any answers....just the standard covering their behinds answer of "everyone is different on the healing process".
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: Does it really take this long? Will the discomfort ever really go away? Will the breast ever be like it was before the biopsy? When I bump it, it just feels different sometimes.
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: I have spoken to my Dr and he said pretty much the same as what you said...everyone is different in the healing process. How long has it been since you've had your biopsy? Have you had a mammogram since? If so,how did that go for you? I just don't know how long it would be to where the pain becomes abnormal. Thank you for sharing your experience.
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Yes, they had me do an MRI before the biopsy.
I have also done ultrasounds. I hope everything goes well fir you tomorrow. I'll say a prayer for you.
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: I had the sterotactic biopsy from hell......no one told me anything...husband tried to ask questions and the Dr's asst stormed out of the room because she said his questions were "unnecessary" and said she was going to get the Dr...didn't even get the right place for the biopsy. Now I have a small knot where the needle was (on one side of where the needle was) and that is scarring me. No one seems to care. How cold these Dr's are and yet don't feel bad for taking our money. I don't get it. How would they like it if they got a taste of their own medicine? I have been a basket case because I'm not getting answers. This is so stressful. I will say a prayer for you all. God is our healer.
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Tomorrow will be 1 month since the biopsy. The hematoma seems smaller but it seems like when I stretch my arm as if I'm reaching for something, I get a twinge of pain off and on for about
 3 min. Or so. Am I irritating this? Also, shouldn't the pain be totally gone by now? I mean it's been a month now! Any pressure against it doesn't feel to great either. I read that when they do mammograms that the hematoma can leave a lump or scar tissue or even calcifications which can make the radiologist think it could be a cancer thus possibly wanting to do a biopsy. When do the biopsies stop? I mean, I got this done because of microcalcifications (which were benign) and now I read that because of the biopsy and hematoma, that can also warrant another biopsy. Ughhh..I just don't want to be running in circles with biopsies ya know?
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: I meant to ask you if they had you go back for another mammogram at 6 months? Are mammograms set at a certain amount of radiation or can they manipulate that and give you more radiation to get a better picture?
Posts.Title: Resources to help painful hematoma 9 mos after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Well now I'm really confused. In getting my annual physical, my primary Dr. (Which I have only seen once a year) looked at my biopsy site. She felt it and said that it wasn't a hematoma but that it was scar tissue with fatty tissue behind it. Can she really diagnose that just by feeling it? I called the Dr who did the biopsy to ask him about
 that and he said that it sounds like its a little bit of the hematoma that created the scar tissue and its pressing against the nerve. Does that even sound logical? I'm not due for another month to get the follow up but he said that my pain (which feels like nerve pain most of the time) doesn't happen that often at this point after the biopsy but then said before, that everyone is different in the healing process. So what should I believe....that what I'm still going through is normal or that what I'm going through doesn't happen that often, but has happened?
This is all so frustrating. :-(
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
Did she not think that there may be an infection? I have heard that red, warm to the touch may be a sign of infection. Not sure how much education they have on that since that's not their "specialty". I'd maybe get a second opinion if it were me or see about
 getting in with who did your biopsy or get in with a breast surgeon or maybe even a GYN Dr. Someone who specializes in breasts. You can do a search on the internet and see what you find. Hope everything works out for you.
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: You're only a week out from the biopsy. It will take some time from what I have been told. They went in with a needle in a very delicate area and the trauma will take some time to heal. I am 9 weeks out and I know how you feel. I am wanting everything to be healed 8 weeks ago. Give it time. Put moist heat on it. Wear a good support bra (which I didn't do) and take it easy on that side. I know they sometimes say that a few days later that you can return to normal activities but for me that wasn't true. I vacuum now and it can irritate the area. I sleep on that side and the pressure can make it hurt a little. So, just take it easy and if you want peace of mind, ask for an ultrasound to see if you have a hematoma. If you do, expect slow healing! Hope you feel better.
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: Mine isn't darker in the area but it is definitely noticeable where both biopsies were. I had the second one done a week after the first because they didn't even get near where they were trying to get to. I'm just wondering if it will be completely healed ever or will the fatty tissue and scar tissue send another red flag to the radiologist and then they'll want to do another biopsy "just to be safe" because they aren't sure what they are seeing you know? I mean, is this a never ending cycle of biopsies now from here on out because of what my previous biopsies have done? I'm almost too nervous to get another mammo because of the radiation because I had soooo many pictures from the first biopsy that was messed up but luckily, the other guy was able to go off my original pictures and didn't have me do more. How long ago did you have your biopsy?
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: What is PASH? I had a core biopsy done 9 weeks ago and still feel discomfort off and on. I did have a hematoma which is a hard lump. You can get an ultrasound done and they can verify if what you have is indeed a hematoma.
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content: Yes good idea. I'm wondering if because I didn't wear the support bra from the start if that has prolonged the healing. Also the fact that I too did things around the house too soon. The ole' saying that you can return to normal activities the next day is not a one healing fit all so to speak. If anything, they should say that everyone is different and also explain the different things that can occur if you do this or that etc...instead of just saying you can return to your normal activities the next day. That's wrong. It took me going out of state to a breast surgeon who works with one of our Dr friends to get some answers which the radiologist should have explained in the first place.
Posts.Title: 9 months after sterotactic biopsy

Posts.Content:
It's been almost 4 months since I had my biopsy. I noticed that the breast that had the biopsy feels different than the healthy one (had it for micro calcifications and came out benign) k7nd of like feels thicker or maybe more lumpy maybe? I just wanted to know those of you that have been post biopsy for awhile, do you notice a difference in your breasts now? I might add that I actually had two stereotactic biopsies 10 days apart vecause the first facility messed up and did not get near where they were suppose to. I developed hematomas from each biopsy. I still feel a tiny little knot from one of the hematomas on the outside of the breast but overall, that breast feels a little more "firm" I guess than the other one. Anyone else experience this?
Thanks for sharing!
Posts.Title: Does your breast feel different post stereotactic biopsy?
